Key Arguments: The Bill infringes on fundamental rights such as privacy, freedom of speech, and freedom of expression.
Mainstream media and unclear government messaging are significant sources of misinformation, yet they are excluded from the Bill.
The Bill represents government overreach in controlling information on the internet.
Education on critical thinking and misinformation identification is a better solution than censorship.
There is a risk of industry capture and bias within ACMA, despite its independence.
The Bill does not address the root causes of misinformation and societal issues.
Government distrust is high, and the Bill could be influenced by corporate interests.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is a gross imposition on our fundamental rights and a step in the wrong direction.
A better solution is educating the public on topics such as critical thinking, identifying misinformation and disinformation.
Government distrust in Australia is at an all-time high.
